channel.title: HTML & Hosting Your Created Documents?
channel.description:
So one thing I've never really understood is that if I made a HTML document on my desktop, how would I then get to host that to the web so that other people could load it up and use/view it?
And if you need to purchase a doman, is there any free alternate ways of doing so (HMTL created documents from NotePad, not getting a free webpage online)?

item.title: HTML & Hosting Your Created Documents?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

if you just wanted a website that is html5/css3/javascript driven you could use dropbox. http://tiny.cc/proofofcon is a little thing i made 2-3 months ago just to test out the idea. its nothing fancy. updating it is as easy as dragging the file you want to upload into you dropbox folder on your computer.

Read full topic

item.title: HTML & Hosting Your Created Documents?
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Of course XAMMP why didn’t I think of that… okay thanks guys.

Read full topic

item.title: HTML & Hosting Your Created Documents?
item.dc:creator: @gravenfire23 gravenfire23
item.description:
@gravenfire23 wrote:

Do you mean like webhosting? you could also just use Xammp if you meant web hosting just open up ur file manager upload your file into your htdocs then have people follow whatever url the site you got ur webhosting at gave you for example www.MYWEBSITEHERE.WEBHOSTINGNAMEHERE.com/FILENAMEHERE.php or if you bought a domain www.MYDOMAINNAMEHERE.com(net or whatever you used).FILENAME.php

Read full topic
